Posts.Content: Hi Jsteph I had DIEP in March last year. I am really pleased with the result! I remember when I came round from the op and had a peek I thought I looked exactly the same as before which was great. I was 4 days in hospital which was fine as I was very well looked after.  The main thing is being quite restricted for a week or two afterwards. We had a freezer full of dinners cooked by my Mum and a friend which made life easier. Also it was actually quite nice to just lay in bed or on the sofa watching TV, reading etc. I only needed paracetamol & ibuprofen once home and only for a few days. It’s important to do all the physio exercises as best you can it won’t be long before you notice improvements. Good luck and let us know when you have a date. Annjac ATB for Wednesday, look forward to hearing from you afterwards!
Posts.Title: Diep

Posts.Content: Next Thursday will be the anniversary of my diagnosis. I can’t believe it is a year already.  It is an emotional time with all the significant dates, feel like they have been branded into my brain!  I am so glad of this forum and all of you posting on here, thank you! Sunshine Kid I hope 25 is a better year for you
Posts.Title: A year

Posts.Content: Hi Julie49 i had DIEP  early 6 months ago. I am really pleased with the result, and how I look in clothing. My new boob is always warm and I’m sure it’s some degrees warmer than my other one.  When my hands are cold it does feel hot. It’s been like this since the op so I presume it will always be. I quite like it!
Posts.Title: Post Diep Reconstruction surgery

Posts.Content: Thanks for your comments about Valerie the ex-bat! We have 6 and they are all doing really well, they seem very happy and we get 3-4 eggs a day.  They are all looking much healthier now after only 2 months. This is Edna yesterday having a sip of tea!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: That’s good news Ronstar, nice one. Hope other folk have had a good day and a bit more warm September sunshine. The pic is from today’s dog walk, furthest one we have done for a while, I really enjoyed it. Out for dinner tonight with OH and stepson. It’s stepsons final evening with us, his Dad is taking him to Uni tomorrow, I still can’t believe it! So the porch is full of crockery, duvets, pans, stationery, etc. Big times! Have a good eve all of you
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi everyone Thursday was my friends birthday and we went to a nearby animal rescue centre, it was great. You could go in most of the enclosures all the animals were very happy and friendly so I had lots of time stroking goats, sheep and cows. Birthday lunch in their vegan cafe. The whole day was good fun and a tonic!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Morning all Violetsniff he looks lovely! The campsite we are on, the dog here only has 3 legs as one was removed due to cancer. I’ve really taken a shine to him and he manages really well.  Pic from yesterday’s walk in the woods. Have a good day everyone hope you get some sunshine
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Merry Christmas to you all!  This thread has been a positive aspect of 2018 for me, really enjoy your comments, pics and encouragement. Thank you for being there
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Happy New Year everyone from sunny Sussex, also mild what a lovely start to the year! Keep walking, running, yogaing, tai chiing and everything else you do
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Evening my friends. It was lovely and sunny here today. i was very happy a work meeting this afternoon got cancelled which meant I could work at home for the afternoon and get out for a walk which I hadn’t expected. It made my day!!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: What a great picture Seaspirit, he is very handsome! i went back to the park at lunch in search of the two white squizzers, only saw one today. Annjac good luck, this time tomorrow you will be cancer free and fussed over!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Lovely pics everyone well done for persevering in the cold. Look what I got for my birthday, I love them, they have been admired by fellow dog walkers! Have a good weekend, Annjac I hope you are doing OK
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Don‘t know where the image has gone, will try again!  xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hurrah
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Mistymoley they look amazing! i am having a nipple reconstruction Tuesday then once it’s healed will probably have the tattoo.
Posts.Title: Permanent nipple tattoo with implant reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi everyone Lovely day here today, all the snow has pretty much gone except where it’s shady. So I had a very muddy dog! It was just wonderful to be outside in the sunshine, made me smile inside. Annjac sorry you are still mending, hopefully there will be an improvement this week. More than one. Violetsniff I loved your experience of Sunday school today HappyFeet1 we have 4 hens, they are all ex battery (started with 6 ) they are great, I love them and we thy are still laying. Thisafternoon we cleared out the shed as we have had a problem with rats, I can’t believe how destructive they have been it took ages to sweep out all the detritus and poo. Very unpleasant but a job well done. Got roast lamb as a reward, carving now...
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Leolady56 that’s ace! I’m on a mission to get our visiting peacocks to show me their full display, I guess I have to be attractive and appealing to them...  Well done everyone who got out today despite the weather. I went for a bluebell walk with a couple of friends and our dogs managed to dodge the rain. good night and good sleeps all of you
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Just got back from my third bike ride since surgery, managed 50 minutes today. I know I will feel pooped later but I really wanted to go as I think after today we are going to get a lot of wet days. Boo! i was hoping to see some lambs to photo but didn’t so instead here is one of my camelli, I hope it brings you a bit of cheer if you have been stuck indoors.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Judith I’m over near  Battle so Hastings is the nearest bit of coast. i hope you were able to get out for a walk today?
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi there Lovely pics of swans and blossom These lambs are from yesterday’s walk, all it has done here today is rain. I took my Mum for a belated Mother’s Day treat, we went on a steam train across some marshes and saw several swans here and there sitting on their nests.  Well done everyone who got out today i think spring is coming back properly from tomorrow onwards, let’s hope so. Have a cosy and comfortable evening
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi all.  Well done with all your activities indoors and out. Loving the Spring factor! Leolady is it Policeman's heel? I hope it gets better soon, it’s a ****** This morning was lovely and sunny so I did my exercise in the garden, with some company from Queenie  bless her.  Hope you get out and about tomo
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Morning all. Loving the bird theme... we have recently been getting visits from 2 peacocks which belong to a neighbour. They seem to be quite tame so I am hoping to get some better pics over time. They are very keen on my ither neighbours bird feeder! Yesterday was a big day for me, I tried my first bicycle ride since before surgery. Only went up the road and back slowly it was great, I have really missed it. I felt very weary in the afternoon but don’t seem to have any consequences today so can start building up to longer rides.  Good luck with your day today everyone.  Amalie x
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Lovely to see all your pics from today, especially the lambs! We got out this morning (me and our old dog) had a grey and drizzly walk before the rain set in. Blinking cold too! Most of the flowers were keeping their heads down except this one. latwr I went to bed for a rest and watched the 1/3 cancer documentary on BBC iPlayer that there is another thread about. I thought it was very well done, gave a positive picture of the cancer teams and all the great work they do.  OH is watching a recording of the Grand Prix, I do wish it wasn’t so noisy!  Have a good evening, stay warm, cosy and lovely.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Afternoon everyone, good to hear your tales of getting out and about. Eddiboy that is a great pic. I will try and get a good one of my dog to put up. Our walk today took us through a nearby crop field, there are broad beans growing there this year and they are all in flower, today for the first time I noticed their fragrance as we walked through, not been aware of it before. So that was an added bonus. I hope everyone is OK and has had some nice moments this weekend. We all need them!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi all I got a splash of sunshine today, only for a few minutes but even so! Im away on a jolly with a couple of girlfriends, on the Kent coast anyone recognise where?
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Violetsniff I love your observations at the gym, that really made me chuckle! Moomy lovely pics I hope you are feeling better now. Annjac I’m so sorry you had that fall, glad someone was there to help you. I know how it can knock your confidence. Hi also to everyone else! This pic is from yesterday it was dull and cold but the daffodils were cheering. I had my first annual mammogram yesterday which was fine and they were lovely, I was quite tearful as first time back in that particular hospital since being told of my diagnosis last Jan.  The corridor, the waiting room etc. Was glad to get home and have the walk. I hope you have some sunshine today
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: That is an amazing tree Violetsniff, what type is it? I wonder how old it is?  Marvellous. I’ve had a lovely afternoon, met a couple of girl friends at a local garden centre, had a lovely veggie lunch there then went round their garden which I have never done before, even though it’s only up the road. It was warm, sunny and lovely. Great way to catch up, I really enjoyed it. The pic is of a wonderful display of Alliums beside a pond  Sleep well all

Posts.Content: Yeh, Glastonbury Tor  top marks AnnJac & Moomy! Good night all, sleep well

All I have to add is some buttercups from yesterday, they cheered me up as it was very dull.   Hopefully we can all dodge the storms over the weekend and get out a bit, enjoy whatever nature has to offer wherever you are. Have a lovely weekend and keep sharing the pics!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hiya Brilliant pics from Dartmoor & Postbridge. I think we have some excellent photographers amongst us! I’m sending a pic  from my visit to my sisters do you know where I am?  I hope you are all having an OK day, if not so far then I hope it gets better
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Well done Flossie yes it’s the Cow & Calf rocks.  Did a lot of walking round Ilkley yesterday, all shops and cafes, I slept very well last night! Happy day everyone
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi there, what a lot of news and pics on this thread, I haven’t been able to look for a few days. Hope everyone is doing OK, good luck Seaspirit and AnnJac for your appointments. Had a lovely walk after work with a friend, the bluebells are coming!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hello all I joined this forum within a couple of days of diagnosis (31 January). I have not posted for ages but I have found huge comfort and support from reading all your messages, thank you.  When it all kicked off I knew that walking and being outside would benefit me all the way through, I love nature and take joy from the most simple things I see and hear whilst out in the countryside. When I went for surgery I made sure I had taken some pics of my favourite places and views to give me good thoughts whilst so restricted and uncomfortable.  I was so pleased within a week or so to be able to go out again and experience it all for real. Even in the snow!  Here is a pic from today’s walk, a promising prospect! Amalie xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Morning. I’m enjoying the pictures of nature, pets and places! This is from yesterday’s walk I think it is a wild orchid. Sitting outside with my coffee listening to the birds and thinking of where I would be otherwise, an hours drive away in an office sitting in front of a screen. In this moment I feel lucky to be where I am. Going away for the weekend with two girl friends, I will be looking out for something to photo see if anyone can guess where we are! have a good day all and enjoy the sunshine wherever you are.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Done it!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi there lovely seeing the flowers and scenery from everyone.  On yesterday’s walk I foraged some wild garlic, then picked a load of nettles from the end of the garden. I made a lovely soup then watched Countryfile where they were doing exactly the same thing! AnnJac good to hear from you, hope you are healing well. The soup has gone sideways!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

It’s a few degrees hotter here than U.K. so I am very happy to be getting in the sea every day to cool off. Done lots of steps as nothing is flat. Also I did an online yoga session this morning which I really enjoyed. I try and do 2-3 a week but haven’t managed any for some time so that feels good too. Have a lovely day!

I felt very pleased with myself afterwards and took it easy for the rest of the day!  Stay cool
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi all, lovely pics and chats going on here! Mine is a trip to the pub garden tomorrow for a couple of hours with the Scrabble. have a nice evening
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi all. I’m not going to attempt to post a pic given your experiences today! Eddiboy, the garlic I just put the leaves straight into the pan then is all got blitzed anyway. I also put some in a lentil dall just chopped it up a bit then it wilted like a spinach would. It’s a great colour, doesn’t taste too strong. Good to hear of all your accomplishments today, walking, running, cycling. Especially in this heat. I’m feeling pleased as I did a bit of yoga earlier, for my mind and soul. Also planted some seeds in the veg bed and put tomato and cucumber seedlings in the greenhouse.  So I’ll be down there first thing tomorrow in my pj’s to check on them! i hope everyone has had some benefit from the weekend and the weather, even if you could only get out a little bit.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Morning all Fenouillard I like the sound of nettle tea, will try some. I’m trying to drink less tea and coffee so I have been making a tea with fresh turmeric which is OK.  Another lovely day here in Sussex, I will be going out on my bicycle this morning before it gets too hot.  The irises are in my front garden. I love them just wish they lasted a bit longer.  Have a good day everyone and hope you can get outside for a bit.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: How lovely to see all your pics!  Spiders web, forest, cygnet, flowers and a river, what a treat all in one day. Aren’t we lucky to be able to see all thesem and share them. this is some hawthorn blossom from our walk, it’s very pretty when you can gst close to it. Did a longer bike ride yesterday (slow and steady) feel OK from it.  I hope you all had a kiss from the sun today, even if it was fleeting. Lots of love
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Thanks Violetsniff, I think that’s exactly what happened. It did take me by surprise! Still got a lot to process I guess... Have a good day everyone
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Morning all, sounds like some lovely activities going on this weekend in the sunshine, what a tonic. Bit too hot for me at times though! We have family staying and yesterday took 2 row boats along the river for a couple of hours. I had a treat as OH and stepson did all the rowing in our boat, I did do 10 mins but kept getting us stuck in the bank... We’ve had a great weekend but I’m a bit weary now. I’m looking forward to later on when everyone has left and we can get back to normal! have a good day everyone
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hello there, it’s been a while. I’ve just had a great time catching up with this thread, all your lovely messages and pictures. That tea pot window made me smile! Realising that being back at work takes up too much time and energy, the heat doesn’t help.   Moomy it might not be the meds, it is just so ******** hot! I love it at first but now I am struggling and not sleeping as well either so it’s a double whammy. I think it is affecting a lot of people in the same way. Moomy also well done for nude yoga!  I try and do a bit of yoga every morning in between the shower and getting dressed. The pic is of a globe artichoke in the garden. It grows a fair amount of globes but they are very small and all ways covered in black fly we’ve never been able to eat one. The colour is so vibrant! Im waiting for the rain to come I think it will in the next hour or so - HURRAH! I may well go out and stand in it till I’m soaked. Can’t really remember what it’s like. Have a nice evening
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Good afternoon! Loving the peacocks and quiz pictures! Here‘s one from our walk this morning, very humid and close here. Hopefully tomorrow will feel a bit fresher. I’m waiting for my friend in a Bannatynes, she is taking me to the spa this will be my first swim since DIEP 7 March. I tried my swimwear on at home and feel OK with how I look, will be interesting to see how the swimming actually is. My car is full of wood chip and chicken feed, we are collecting 6 ex battery hens on Sunday. I am very excited! Look out for pics...  Happy Friday everyone
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Good quiz Violetsniff! Is it one of those small chinese leaf lettuces?

Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Violetsniff I can’t wotk out what the tool is behind your scissors, is it to do with sewing? I think that one is Level 5! I saw this lovely fella on my walk today, he is an Exmoor pony though I was on the South Downs Way. I reckon I did 6 miles and I can feel it... I hope you’ve all had a good weekend and got out and done or seen something nice

Posts.Content: Hi chums, not Shropshire or Derbyshire though good guesses. I’m in Yorkshire and admittedly it’s not the best pic. I’m restricted to jigsaws and draughts which is a lot easier. Hugs to you all

I was only away for a few days visiting my sister, when I got back Wednesday I really noticed the fluffy new feathers our ex bats are growing already. It’s a good sign! Have a good day wherever you are and I hope you get out in the sun a bit.

Posts.Content: Moomy I bet you had a great time at Herstmonceux, what a lovely day for it. Come on England!,

Posts.Content: Hiya  I had a lovely bike ride this morning. Today’s walk is yet to come, a short one up to the pub for pizza night. Haven’t been for ages, I’m very much looking forward to it especially as I will have done two activities by then! I hope you are having a sunny evening.

Posts.Content: Hiya Lovely pics and updates, sounds like a virtuous day all round, good stuff! We went rowing along the river, very peaceful and tranquil. Now in bed eating chocolate AGAIN

I do enjoy the World Cup so it was great to be here for Croatia winning on penalties! Will be watching our boys tonight.

Posts.Content: Morning chums. Yesterday I was out on my bike, I went past a local farm that was hosting a wedding. They had decorated the pillars with what I thought was flowers, I stopped and went back for a close look as they were quite stunning. They were actually pom poms!

Posts.Content: Moomy he is gorgeous! I hope you had a good walk. Ruby Rose enjoy your holiday and make the most of the warmth and sunshine. This pic is from yesterday a lovely autumn walk in the woods. Have a nice evening

Posts.Content: Morning everyone! Nice to catch up with your pics and messages, I have been reading and enjoying them but not got round to posting for a while. I’ve been a bit tired and weary from being back at work, I think also the heat was a factor. I never thought I would be so happy to see rain, especially 2 days in a row! i did some yoga yesterday and if it stops raining will go for a short bike ride later... The pic is from a walk I did with a couple of friends and our dogs on Wednesday, down by the coast. We went along the beach one way then back alongside an old canal. Have a good day all, whatever you are doing!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi everyone I’ve been enjoying your updates and pictures. Im in Cornwall this week but I can’t upload any pics because the internet connection is so slow where we are staying. Anyway we are having a lovely time (I’m here with a friend and dogs) it’s a cancer treat! Did a good walk yesterday on the beach at Portwrinkle.  Whilst we were down there we had a sudden downpour which then turned to hail it was quite something. Good sunshine on our drive back and we had a double rainbow which we almost drove through, if you know what I mean! Have a good evening, keep warm
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi everyone well done for getting out and walking, shopping, rowing and anything else active! I had a spin round the park in my lunch break and did the stairs x 2 today at work. On the sofa now! Keep warm

I did a good swim, can feel it now (in bed eating chocolate) The pic is from a border in the hotel garden.

This pic is from yesterday, Joyce and Valerie enjoying a bask. Bless them. I love those girls! Wishing you all a restorative and peaceful sleep

I have been less active than usual over Christmas, I haven’t been out on my bike at all, just taking the pooch for his walks but he is so old and slow now it’s not particularly energetic! I’m really pleased with it, have to go back in April to get it touched up.  Also today is the first anniversary of my diagnosis. It will always be a significant date for me now, glad I’m feeling well and positive first time round!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: What lovely pictures, I haven’t had many walks this week so I’ve enjoyed yours! I had an unusual walk on Wednesday. 30 minutes on a treadmill in a chamber at 35 degrees. I got a right sweat on! I’m participating in some research for a local PHD student. She is looking into the effects of exercising in different temperatures for women who have had BC compared with women that haven’t.  It’s quite interesting, I had all sorts of things stuck on me to examine the composition of my sweat, my skin temp, my core temp (via a probe/cable up my jacksy) plus breathing into a tube and bag every 4 minutes.  Weighed, measured, urine sample. Got to go back twice more, next time I think is only 25 degrees. I am defers going for a nice countryside walk tomorrow whatever the weather!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hiya 100 pages that’s great, well done all of us. And thank you Leolady for getting it started! We got our new hens yesterday, 6 ex battery girls. Bless them a couple are in such poor condition it made me cry. Hopefully we can offer them a happy and healthy retirement. Will be thinking of names over the next couple of days. Hope you are all good and getting out and about as best you can.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Morning all Swimming, gymming, yoga, knitting, walking, running aren’t we all doing well! I’m going for a bike ride this morning. The hens are doing well, bless them.  We have actually named them already with a bit of help from OH’s grand daughter: Sidney, Edna, Queenie, Valerie, Joyce and Marjorie.  It is great spending time with them and watching them explore their new world, they haven’t even known weather as kept inside a big facility with artificial light on for about 18 hours a day. Makes me feel ashamed to be human. Anyways, onwards and upwards for them, I will try and get some better pics. Have a good day all of you

Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi there Had a lovely dog walk this morning before it got too hot, saw these two little fellas they made me smile!  Thisafternoon I went back to the hospital for surgery/wound follow up and to see if I wanted anything further.  I felt absolutely fine driving over, then once I got into the hospital grounds I felt really emotional. I had to wait a while and got tears in the waiting room, then when I saw the registrar I was quite weepy, I was so embarrassed. She was lovely, I tried to explain that it was just being back at the hospital even though my experience there had been really positive and I was very pleased with everything they have done. When I got back in the car I had to have a good blub before I felt able to drive home. now I am feeling fine again!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Also we went out for breakfast today and sat outside in the sunshine it was wonderful. I get cold really easily but it was so nice and out of the breeze it was me that suggested it.  Usually I’m the one who wants to stay inside.  Have a nice sleep
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Evening everyone, I hope it has been a good day wherever and however you are. My Mindfulness mantra for today is: Enjoy doing any tasks or jobs more mindfully today. I’m not keen on tasks at the best of times, especially in this heat but I did have to clean the chickens out earlier. I left it till this evening so it was cooler, it’s not a pleasant job but very satisfying and it gives them a chance to run about in the garden for an hour or so which is good. I took my time and was mindful about it, it is a better way to be if you can when you’re not rushing around. They are ex battery we have had them about 6 weeks now and they are doing well, all improving. I hope the pic uploads it is Sidney who was in the worst condition, she finally has some new feathers coming through, bless her. i half watched the football...

Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi everyone what a few days it has been... Hope you are all OK, Leolady lovely to see your post,  I hope things are OK with you. And thank you again for starting this one! Get this, last Tuesday a close colleague went off sick, she had some symptoms and generally felt unwell. Fast forward to this Tuesday, admitted to hospital and diagnosed with Bile Duct Cancer which has made her liver go into failure. She discharged herself last night, waiting to hear what they can offer which will probs be palliative care.  WTF? She is a lovely lady, just turned 59 and optimistic about making positive changes to her life in her 60th year. I’m her supervisor and we have become quite close over the last few months, she has shared a lot with me and I have huge respect for her. Soz to share this, still trying to comprehend and process it all.  Went to see her in hospital yesterday with my manager then we went back to the office and had to tell everyone.  I am blessed to have such a good team, we are all comfortable to share tears and hugs when necessary. Its reinforced my belief in making each day the best experience it can be, whatever you are doing. Making sure there is something enjoyable regularly enough to keep a good balance and enhance wellbeing. Fucking canccer. Anyways I’ve had a quiet day thinking about her and had a good walk which was a tonic.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi there, thank you for your kind thoughts about my colleague. It’s grim. Your pics and news have cheered me, AnnJac imagine Tuesday! It will be amazing, I hope you enjoy your time in town and get around comfortably Heres a pic from yesterday’s walk at a local country park.

Not much to report from here except I have a new toy see pic! My step son is visiting, he has joined in the fun and we now have a leader board on the fridge for our time trials. I’m winning so far!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi Howaboutthat  I had DIEP recon last year and I am really pleased with the result. Have since had nipple recon and tattoo done.  A big factor with DIEP is recovery time and the limitations for the first couple of weeks. I was 4 nights in hospital and only needed paracetamol and ibuprofen when I came home. You can’t drive for 4 weeks and you are restricted with your movements and lifting/carrying things etc.  I just gave into it, had a lot of sofa and TV time!
Posts.Title: Mastectomy and reconstruction advise

Posts.Content: Morning Howaboutthat My new breast feels fairly natural though there is a hard lump on the underside, which interestingly always feels a bit warmer than the rest of the area. I don’t have much sensation either, when I had the nipple recon I didn’t need any anaesthetic as I couldn’t feel anything. I’ve never had any pain since the original scars healed. The surgeon was very clear with me that the aim of the surgery is to provide a new ‘breast shape’ that would give symmetry and look OK in clothing and swimwear.  This is exactly the result and if anything I now have a better body shape because of the tummy tuck. Good luck with your decision.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy and reconstruction advise

Posts.Content: Hi all im all over the place this last couple of weeks with my emotions, mostly fine but easily burst into tears and feeling sad. It can happen anytime. Generally I’m fine when with others (and all my family & friends have been lovely) it’s other times when I’m on my own probably just thinking about ME ME ME because I’m geting better at that. I’m aware my situation could be much worse and I am recovering well from my surgery (mx & DIEP). In fact everything at this stage is as good as it could be I think I’m just realising something big has happened and I am still adjusting to it. im starting counselling next week with a local charity who support people living with cancer hopefully it will help me process all this. Also I don’t mind what is going on, I’m sure it’s a natural part of the process and healthy to express it.  When you can’t or don’t want to share moments like this with others in your life this forum is a great place to do so. Thank you all for helping me feel part of something and not alone with it... Onward and upward (and every which way it takes us)...
Posts.Title: mixed emotions

Posts.Content: Hi Sweendog I really feel for you having to deal with all this being so young, bless you. I had a right mastectomy and reconstruction using tummy tissue just over 2weeks ago. I’ve never had any surgery before, nor been in hospital so I was quite apprehensive and unsure what to expect. All the staff, surgeon and anaesthetists were so respectful and reassuring I felt in very good hands. With mine they removed the nipple and cut a slightly larger hole around the area. They used the hole to take all the breast tissue out and put the new tissue in. When I came round from the op I was nervous about having a look, but when I saw what they had done I was amazed! I look exactly the same as I did before (sisters not twins) the work is very neat and I am really pleased with my decision.  I had 3nights in hospital and I’m doing well, haven’t really had pain just some discomfort at times. Doing all the physio exercises fine. Had the wounds checked Monday everything is clean and mending well. I feel good in myself, the main issue is being slow and tired. Have to take life at a much slower pace and needing a lot of quiet/down time.  I’m 47 and not had children, got small boobs. This next stage will be a big time for you, good to be asking about it and give yourself time and space to process all the information, it’s quite overwhelming so it’s good to have a few weeks to get your head round it all. I hope your experience is as positive as mine (and many others) has been, no reason you won’t be pleased with the results. Take care Amalie
Posts.Title: masterctomy and reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi Sweendog Yes, I found a lump 9 Jan and got diagnosed 31st Jan. I thought there was only 1lump but when I went back last week for the follow up they told me they had removed 3. They were all quite small. Good news is they removed them all with a good margin so the cancer is gone, also at surgery they checked my lymph nodes and they were all clear. I don’t have a nipple at the moment which is really the only weird thing about it. I can get a nipple reconstruction further down the line which I probably will. I hope you are doing OK today Amalie xx
Posts.Title: masterctomy and reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi Leolady, I have been thinking of you too and wondering how you are. Sending you positive vibes and a hug
Posts.Title: Shout out to lovely Leolady56

Posts.Content: I’ve had one for a few years, it makes a difference to me I keep it at work.  Definitely worth a try
Posts.Title: Light Boxes for SAD any advice/info please.

Posts.Content: Hiya I’m just into my second month with Tamoxifen, I’ve got Relonchem. It seems OK so far except for feeling weary. Find it harder to get up in the morning though once I am up and about I feel normal. It hasn’t been a problem so far but I start back at work in a couple of weeks so that will be interesting!  I take it in the morning.
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen brands UK list? trying to find one that suits me!

Posts.Content: Hi Yve I had the DIEP reconstruction 7 March, it went well and wounds/scars are healing very nicely. My surgeon was very clear that the purpose of the surgery was to deal with the breast disease and give symmetry/good appearance in clothing. I am really pleased with how I look in clothes and swimwear, better than before as I did have a bit of a tummy!  My new boob is smaller than it’s sister and a bit hard but no-one would know except me and my OH. Incidentally he was amazed with what a good job the surgeons did. I am going back to see him next week and will probably arrange to have a nipple reconstruction. The hardest part for me was the initial 2 weeks after surgery. I wasn’t in pain, just discomfort but quite restricted and very tired. So if you can plan for this, download some box sets, get some dinners in the freezer and take up offers from friends to help with cleaning, shopping etc it will all help you. Good luck!
Posts.Title: reconstruction with abdominal fap

Posts.Content: Lesley Helen thank you for starting this thread, what a great idea. I’ve enjoyed all the thoughts so far,  I had hoped for some words of wisdom to post but nothing springs to mind yet. I’m sure it will and when that happens I’ll share it here. In the meantime I will carry on being inspired by others!
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: Morning all Here is a poem I found in February, I had just been diagnosed.  I was waiting for some friends who were coming over for a pub lunch, as usual they were quite late but I felt better sitting in our local pub than I did pacing around at home. In the alcove are some book shelves and I came across a small tatty book: Quiet Corner by Patience Strong. I flicked through and here it is Comfort (1937) When the soul is plunged into the depths of dark despair When the heart is heavy with its load of human care When it seems that we shall never see the light again Blinded by our sorrows, the tear drops and the pain That’s the time when unseen hands reach down to take our own Loved ones press around us though we think we stand alone Angel wings enfold us safe from every hurt and harm Something seems to come to us and make us strong and calm Comfort steals upon the heart, we know not how or why Suddenly the light comes flooding o’er the darkened sky ‘God shall wipe away all tears’ - this promise shall remain And strengthened, healed and comforted, we face the world again. I hope you like it Have a good day everyone
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: I saw this today whilst padding around Dubrovnik, it made me smile! You can’t buy happiness but you can buy ice cream
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: Here’s on I like from Star Wars That’s  how we are going to win: not fighting what we hate, but saving what we love.
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: I went for a lovely bike ride this morning, it reminded me of another quote from Einstein (one of my favourites): Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance you must keep moving. Innit!
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: Morning all this quote came through on my yoga email yesterday, thought it was worth sharing here. Easier said than done but wise words none the less! It’s what I am working on... “You have to break the habit of thinking that the solution to your problems is to rearrange things outside. The only permanent solution to your problems is to go inside and let go of the part of you that seems to have so many problems with reality.” Have a good day
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..

Posts.Content: I always look at this thread because the messages are comforting and inspiring.  Here’s one I saw the other evening, on the blackboard in a local venue we use for our BC support group. Don’t know if the pic will work or if you will be able to read it, here’s what it says: Stand at the crossroads and look, Ask for the ancient paths Ask where the good way is And walk in it And you will find rest for your souls Don’t know the source or if someone just made it up! Anyways I liked it.
Posts.Title: Thought for the Day..
